intro: Olgasis triquetra, commonly known as the three-cornered leek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, grassy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild, onion-like flavor, making it a useful plant in both ornamental and culinary contexts. Olgasis triquetra is also valued for its ability to thrive in rocky or dry environments.
